thing-type.label: ZMNHXD Qubino 3-Phase Smart Meter
thing-type.description: Qubino 3-Phase Smart Meter<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtQubino 3-Phase Smart Meter is used for energy measurements in three-phase electrical power network. It reduces energy consumption, lowers your utility</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtFACTORY RESET</strong&gt</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtConnect the device to the power supply</li&gt <li&gtPress and hold the S service button between 6 seconds and 20 seconds</li&gt <li&gtDevice will be removed from you network</li&gt </ol&gt<p&gt<strong&gtLED1 (Green)</strong&gt</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtLED is ON = Power ON, module is included</li&gt <li&gtLED is 1s OFF, 1s ON = Power ON, module is excluded</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gt<strong&gtLED2 (Yellow)</strong&gt</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtExternal IR relay enabled only <ul&gt<li&gtLED is ON = External IR relay is turned ON</li&gt <li&gtLED is OFF = External IR relay is turned OFF</li&gt <li&gtLED is 0.5s OFF, 0.5s ON = IR communication error</li&gt </ul&gt</li&gt <li&gtExternal TRIAC relay enabled only <ul&gt<li&gtLED is ON = External IR relay is turned ON</li&gt <li&gtLED is OFF = External IR relay is turned OFF</li&gt </ul&gt</li&gt <li&gtBoth TRIAC an IR enabled <ul&gt<li&gtLED is ON = External IR relay is turned ON</li&gt <li&gtLED is OFF = External IR relay is turned OFF</li&gt <li&gtLED is 0.5s OFF, 0.5s ON = IR communication error</li&gt </ul&gt</li&gt <li&gtExternal IR relay disabled <ul&gt<li&gtLED is ON = modbus packet is sent</li&gt <li&gtLED is OFF = modbus packet is received</li&gt </ul&gt</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gt<strong&gtAUTOMATICALLY ADDING THE DEVICE TO A Z-WAVE NETWORK (AUTO INCLUSION)</strong&gt</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtEnable add/remove mode on your Z-Wave gateway (hub)</li&gt <li&gtAutomatic selection of secure/insecure inclusion</li&gt <li&gtThe device can be automatically added to a Z-Wave network during the first 2 minutes</li&gt <li&gtConnect the device to the power supply</li&gt <li&gtAuto-inclusion will be initiated within 5 seconds of connection to the power supply and the device will automatically enroll in your network</li&gt </ol&gt<p&gtNOTE: For S2 inclusion please check chapter – »16. Z-Wave Security«.</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtMANUALLY ADDING THE DEVICE TO A Z-WAVE NETWORK (MANUAL INCLUSION)</strong&gt</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtConnect the device to the power supply</li&gt <li&gtEnable add/remove mode on your Z-Wave gateway (hub)</li&gt <li&gtToggle the Service button S between 0.2 and 6 seconds</li&gt <li&gtA new multi-channel device will appear on your dashboard</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gt<strong&gtREMOVAL FROM A ZWAVE NETWORK (Z-WAVE EXCLUSION)</strong&gt</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtConnect the device to the power supply</li&gt <li&gtMake sure the device is within direct range of your Z-Wave gateway (hub) or use a hand-held Z-Wave remote to perform exclusion</li&gt <li&gtEnable add/remove mode on your Z-Wave gateway (hub)</li&gt <li&gtPress and hold the S service button between 0.2 and 6 seconds</li&gt <li&gtThe device will be removed from your network but custom configuration parameters will not be erased</li&gt </ol&gt

parameter.name: config_7_1
parameter.label: 7: Input switch (i1) function selection
parameter.description: Available configuration parameters for input switch I1<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<ul&gt<li&gt0 – disabled</li&gt <li&gt2 – IR external relay control – mono stable push button</li&gt <li&gt3 – IR external relay control – bi-stable switch</li&gt <li&gt4 – External relay control – mono stable push button</li&gt <li&gt5 – External relay control – bi-stable switch</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gt<strong&gtNote!</strong&gt</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtBy setting the parameter 7 to value 4 or 5 the external Relay (IKA) is working with input switch without enabling parameter no. 101</li&gt <li&gtTo make the IR Relay (BICOM) responsive to the digital input, in addition to the setting of the configuration parameter 7, parameter 100 must also be set to value 1 or 2.</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

options.option: IR ext relay ctrl – mono stable push btn
IR external relay control – bi-stable switch
External relay control – mono stable push button

parameter.name: config_40_1
parameter.label: 40: Reporting on power change
parameter.description: This parameter is valid for Active Powers Total, Phase1, Phase2 and Phase3.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtAvailable configuration parameters (data type is 1 Byte DEC)</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtDefault value 50</li&gt <li&gt0 – reporting disabled</li&gt <li&gt1-100 = 1% - 100% reporting enabled. Power report is send only when actual power in Watts (in real time changes for more than set percentage comparing to previous Active Power, step is 1%.</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gt<strong&gtNOTE:</strong&gt if power change is less than 5 W, the report is not send (pushed).<br /&gt<strong&gtNOTE:</strong&gt Device is measuring also some disturbances even if on the output is no load. To avoid disturbances:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtIf measured Active Power (W) is below e.g. 5W-&gt; the reported value in this case is 0W</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_42_2
parameter.label: 42: Reporting on time interval
parameter.description: Energy report time intervals<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter is currently valid only for Active Energy Total Import/Export (kWh), Reactive<br /&gtEnergy Total (kvarh), Total Energy (kVAh)</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtAvailable configuration parameters (data type is 2 Byte DEC)</strong&gt</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtDefault value 600 (600 seconds - 10 minutes)</li&gt <li&gt0 – reporting disabled</li&gt <li&gt600-65536 = 600 (600 seconds – 65536 seconds). Reporting enabled. Report is send with the time interval set by entered value.</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gt<strong&gtNote:</strong&gt Device is reporting only if there was a change of 0.1 in Energy</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtNote:</strong&gt In the future will be possible to measure and report also Active Energy on PH1, PH2 and PH3.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_43_2
parameter.label: 43: Other Values - Reporting on time interval
parameter.description: Energy reports for Voltage, Current, Total Power Factor, Total Reactive Power<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt<strong&gtAvailable configuration parameters (data type is 2 Byte DEC)</strong&gt</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtDefault value 600 (600 seconds - 10 minutes)</li&gt <li&gt0 – reporting disabled</li&gt <li&gt600-65536 = 600 (600 seconds – 65536 seconds). Reporting enabled. Report is sent with the time interval set by entered value.</li&gt <li&gtNote: Device is reporting only if there was a change</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_100_1
parameter.label: 100: Enable / Disable External IR relay (BICOM)
parameter.description: Enable / Disable External IR relay (BICOM)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtAvailable configuration parameters (data type is 1 Byte DEC):</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtdefault value 0</li&gt <li&gt0 – External IR relay disabled</li&gt <li&gt1 – External IR relay enabled and connected to all 3 Phases</li&gt <li&gt2 – External IR relay enabled and connected to a Phase 1</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gt<strong&gtNOTE1:</strong&gt After parameter change, first exclude module (without setting parameters to default value) and then re include the module.</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtNOTE 2:</strong&gt If you don't have IR BICOM relay module mounted and you enable IR communication (parameter 100 is 1 or 2) there will be no valid IR relay state reported. It will be reported IR COMMUNICATION ERROR and LED2 will BLINK.</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: IR relay enabled for all 3 phases

parameter.name: config_101_1
parameter.label: 101: Enable / Disable External relay (IKA)
parameter.description: Enable / Disable External relay (IKA)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtAvailable configuration parameters (data type is 1 Byte DEC):</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtdefault value 0</li&gt <li&gt0 – External relay disabled</li&gt <li&gt1 – External relay enabled and connected to Phase 2</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gt<strong&gtNOTE:</strong&gt After parameter change, first exclude module (without setting parameters to default value) and then re include the module.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_106_2
parameter.label: 106: maximum power threshold of all phases together
parameter.description: maximum power threshold of all phases together<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtExternal IR relay (BICOM) power threshold settings – maximum power of all phases together</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter defines a threshold when External IR relay is being turned off. (If Parameter no. 100 is set to the value 1 or 2)</p&gt <p&gtAvailable configuration parameters (data type is 2 Byte<br /&gtDEC)</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtDefault value 0</li&gt <li&gt0 – no function</li&gt <li&gt10-60000 – 10W-60000W</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gt<strong&gtNOTE:</strong&gt Meter is capable of measuring max 3x65A!</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_112_2
parameter.label: 112: Power threshold – Delay before power on
parameter.description: Power threshold – Delay before power on<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtExternal IR relay/ External relay is turned off due to detected overload (as set by parameter 106&amp;107) and remains off for a time, defined in this parameter. After that time, the output turns on to check, if the overload is still present.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable configuration parameters (data type is 2 Byte DEC)</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtDefault value 0 (disabled)</li&gt <li&gt0 – External IR relay/ External relay will not turn back on</li&gt <li&gt30 – 32535 = 30 s – 32535 s</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gt<strong&gtNOTE:</strong&gt the delay time may be prolonged for more then 10s of the time set by the parameter.</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: External relay will not turn back on

parameter.name: group_1
parameter.label: 1: Lifeline
parameter.description: Lifeline group (reserved for communication with the gateway (hub))
